content: I'm interested in lean4 metaprogramming, and, mainly as practice, I wanted to contribute a very small linter that checks if docstrings have padding /-- with whitespace/newlines surrounding the actual documentation -/, after noticing that this was a common nitpick in some PRs. Is mathlib4 a good place to contribute this linter, or would Batteries be a better fit?
The topic of linting doc-strings was already discussed, at least here: #lean4 > style guide for comments?.
Tristan Figueroa-Reid has marked this topic as resolved.
I don't think that there was a strong preference in favour of some style vs another, so it might be good to reach consensus on something that has clear support, before writing a linter.
(Unless, of course, the purpose is a learning process, in which case, my comments are irrelevant!)
It isn't irrelevant! I'm actually quite surprised that a consensus wasn't reached.
There is also another stream with linter requests, if you're looking for inspiration (though some of them may also not have good consensus).
I'm on mobile now, but linter requests may actually be the topic name.
